NIHSlcms 0.0.0.9002

Default parameters for optimization of retention time correction and grouping parameters

lcms_default_corgroup_params.Rd

The function creates default parameters for optimizing retention time correction and grouping algorithms. We perform parameter optimization on the XCMS preprocessing algorithms using the IPO Package. Use this function to create the template within lcms_corgroup_optimization function.

lcms_default_corgroup_params(profStep = 1, gapExtend = 2.7,
  optimize = TRUE)

Arguments

profStep

set the m/z step for generating profile (matrix) data from raw mass spectral data. Smaller steps yield more precision at the cost of greater memory usage.
gapExtend

numeric(1) defining the penalty for gap enlargement. The default value for gapExtend depends on the value of distFun, for distFun = "cor" and distFun = "cor_opt" it is 2.4, for distFun = "cov" 11.7, for distFun = "euc" 1.8 and for distFun = "prd" 7.8.
optimize

by default is TRUE. If FALSE, the function does not optimize the parameters

Value

A parameters template for retention time correction and grouping optimization

See also

Other optimization functions: lcms_default_peakpicking_params, lcms_peakpicking_optimization, write_opt_params

Examples

default_corgroup_params <- lcms_default_corgroup_params(optimize = TRUE)
print(default_corgroup_params)
#> $distFunc
#> [1] "cor_opt"
#> 
#> $gapInit
#> [1] 0.0 0.4
#> 
#> $gapExtend
#> [1] 2.7
#> 
#> $profStep
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $plottype
#> [1] "none"
#> 
#> $response
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $factorDiag
#> [1] 2
#> 
#> $factorGap
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $localAlignment
#> [1] 0
#> 
#> $retcorMethod
#> [1] "obiwarp"
#> 
#> $bw
#> [1] 22 38
#> 
#> $minfrac
#> [1] 0.3 0.7
#> 
#> $mzwid
#> [1] 0.015 0.035
#> 
#> $minsamp
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $max
#> [1] 50
#>
